column1: National coronavirus cases are the highest they have ever been and rising but the Republican-controlled Senate still refuses to compromise on either of the two comprehensive pandemic aid packages we passed in the House months ago.

I look forward to working w/ his admin on a host of pressing issues including bringing direct relief to our communities jump-starting our economy centering science in the fight against COVID+the climate crisis improving our health care+making our food system more sustainable.

Maine has 183 new cases of COVID-19 the highest single-day increase since the pandemic began. @GovJanetMills has acted swiftly to keep Mainers safe by mandating that face coverings now be worn in all public settings.  Wear a 😷 keep 6’ ↔️ apart save a life--it's that simple. https://t.co/mnvpFmt7p5

Pres. Trump has made many false claims about the development of a vaccine before Election Day. We all want a vaccine ASAP but it must be guided by science.   My House colleagues & I are urging @SecAzar to ensure all COVID vaccine decisions are free from political interference. https://t.co/jbR3vXmmLL
The Senate has adjourned until after the election with no COVID relief.   President Trump and Senate Republicans only care about holding on to power not the well-being of Americans.

GOOD NEWS⬇️⬇️⬇️   I’ve urged @USDA to abandon this cruel policy for months. When Maine imposed a similar policy during the LePage admin it increased our state's food insecurity to 15.8%. With hunger on the rise due to COVID this rule would have put lives in jeopardy. #mepolitics https://t.co/Fc5qcIozfj

We’re dealing with a staggering rise in hunger worldwide due to COVID-19.  I fully support @FAO’s goal of zero hunger by 2030 and hope the bipartisan #WorldFoodDay resolution I’ve introduced with @RepMcGovern & @jackiewalorski raises awareness of that worthy goal.

Food insecurity is skyrocketing. Many children receive their only meals at school but #COVID19 has made them more difficult to access.   @Ilhan & I have led calls to extend school meal flexibility through the entire school year so no child goes hungry. https://t.co/NPwPkzwHId

A week has passed since the House passed a compromise COVID relief package to:   💵Send Americans a 2nd stimulus check  👩‍🍳Strengthen small business relief esp. for restaurants & live venues  💼 Extend unemployment insurance through Jan  🏫 Provide $436B in state & local aid https://t.co/BTfw2nmoMx

October is always Arts & Humanities Month but 2020 isn’t like other years. Maine’s cultural economies are hurting due to the Covid recession.   Want to drive home the importance of supporting the arts? Participate in @Americans4Arts 30-day Instagram #ShowYourArt2020 challenge. https://t.co/9q4j9aS3DM
I wish President Trump and the First Lady a full recovery from COVID-19.   I am thinking of them and the millions of other Americans who are currently battling this horrible virus.
The failure of Pres. Trump & Senate Republicans to approve a COVID-19 relief bill has done more to defund the police than anything else.

The US has the most recorded coronavirus deaths of any country in the world.    It didn’t have to be like this.    Pres. Trump knew COVID was “more deadly than even your strenuous flus” but failed to prepare the country for the pandemic and undermined science at every turn.

The COVID-19 recession has caused millions of Americans to lose their employer-sponsored health insurance in the middle of a pandemic. Your employment status should not determine if you can receive health care.   America needs a public option.

6000000 Americans now have Covid-19-related pre-existing conditions.   And yet Senate Republicans are rushing to approve an extremist justice right before the SCOTUS hears the Trump Admin’s challenge to the ACA and its patient protections.

This week America passed a tragic milestone of 200000 deaths from COVID-19.   For the last four months the U. S. Senate has refused to pass any economic aid and is instead dropping everything to install another far-right ideologue on the Supreme Court.

Alternative headline: As GOP-held Senate rushes SCOTUS confirmation weeks before the election millions wait for economic relief.   📢 📢📢 The US House passed a COVID relief bill more than *four months ago.*  https://t.co/GUf12E8j6d

200000 Americans have died from COVID-19.   Millions are on the brink of eviction out of work & grappling with hunger.   The #HeroesAct has been sitting on McConnell’s desk for 4+months.   What are Pres. Trump and Senate Republicans focused on? Ramming through a SCOTUS nominee. https://t.co/ukB9N8RN6n

Between the job loss coming evictions food insecurity and more COVID-19 has taken a toll on Mainers that can't be communicated in mere numbers. Mainers recently told me why they so urgently need support from the federal government to weather this crisis: https://t.co/zpw2PJ3iO5

The #COVID19 pandemic is hitting state & local government hard forcing many to make devastating cuts to public education. The #HeroesAct provides ~$1 trillion in state & local relief to preserve funding for students and schools. The Senate must pass this bill. #FamiliesFirst https://t.co/aZb80TKjpG

Unemployment has run out.  Food insecurity is spiking.  Evictions are near.  Cities & towns are on the brink.  Small businesses need help yesterday.  And the Senate is going on vacation without passing any relief.  The House passed a comprehensive COVID aid package 90 days ago! https://t.co/01iB6UsXFG

PRETTY SWEET🍁: Following the advocacy of Maine’s congressional delegation & @GovJanetMills @USDA has now approved maple sap farmers for direct COVID relief payments.   This is welcome news for Maine’s unrivaled maple syrup industry! (Sorry NH & VT ours is truly #1!)  🍁🍁🍁 https://t.co/ioynu7KJgb

First this is pure racism.   Second he’s weaponizing the suffering of millions who are housing insecure to help his re-election & deflect from his own complete failure to contain COVID-19. https://t.co/LPxqTRxlZL

GREAT NEWS FOR MAINE 💐FARMS & GROWERS: @USDA has announced cut flowers now qualify as commodities which are eligible for direct #COVID relief payments!   As Co-Chair of the Congressional Cut Flower Caucus I requested this change back in April. https://t.co/2EiUDwnZm0

Immigrants contribute billions to the US treasury. It's wrong that they haven’t seen a cent of #COVID relief from their gov't.   I agree w/ the @bangordailynews ed board⤵️  That's why I'm one of 82 members demanding support for these taxpayers in the next COVID relief package. https://t.co/tWnDGcexDS https://t.co/GwqR7VOFX3

🧵Maine entrepreneurs have told me that a one-size-fits-all loan program alone won’t save them. Every small business is unique.  We know the COVID recession will not be solved overnight.  It's time for Congress to think beyond the next aid package to support small businesses.

There are 7600 farms in Maine but less than 400 have received @USDA’s COVID relief aid so far.   Today I wrote Secretary Perdue demanding answers as to why small diversified farms aren’t getting the help they need. #mepolitics https://t.co/Vcd8ytmQV0

I feel like a broken record but it must be said: The House passed a comprehensive Covid-19 package 81 days ago! Our bill would increase SNAP benefits by 15% because food insecurity is spiking nationwide. https://t.co/DOVsyE3Owp

1000 Americans are dying of Covid every day. Nearly 5 million are battling the disease. 158000 have lost their lives to it.  He’s not arguing about fictional crowd size. He’s trying to convince us the American lives lost are merely statistics that he can spin. Disgraceful. https://t.co/IM6aWe3btH

Covid-19 has shown the urgent need to bridge Maine’s digital divide.  Just this month Mainers voted by a 3-to-1 margin to expand rural broadband.   The #HeroesAct provides $$$ for Maine to stay connected during the pandemic. The Senate must pass our bill!  #RuralBroadbandDay https://t.co/tSXRk1QcdV

For 55 years Medicare & Medicaid have given Americans access to lifesaving care.  Maine was the first state to expand Medicaid via the ballot box.  PS: With 5000000+ people losing employer-sponsored insurance due to the Covid-recession it’s past time for Medicare for All. https://t.co/vLkaRSHBtZ

QUICK REMINDER:  • The Trump admin is in court right now trying to dismantle the ACA  • President Trump won’t commit to making a COVID vaccine free despite taxpayers funding its R & D  • The 2017 GOP Tax Scam gave away billions to Rx companies https://t.co/lr6RdQ7QNz

Pre-pandemic Maine had ~180k people struggling w/ food insecurity. @FeedingMaine estimates this number could climb to 250k people.   It's shameful that the GOP’s latest COVID bill would allow businesses to write off fancy business lunches but won’t help struggling families eat. https://t.co/1AqmAxnAYC

The Senate GOP’s COVID bill includes *NO* new city & town aid. It only allows use of existing CARES Act funds.   #HeroesAct has $875B in desperately needed aid for states.   Here’s what each Maine city & town would receive from the House bill: https://t.co/LM1OeUUPb9  #mepolitics https://t.co/v5kZfZXpp6

RN the Senate’s proposed #Covid19 relief bill provides NO funding for states + municipalities.   By contrast the House-passed Heroes Act includes $5+ Billion for Maine cities + towns.   W/o fed aid taxes will go up & services will be cut. It’s essential. https://t.co/EnpQwFVcBb

Maine’s logging industry has been hit hard by #COVID19 the Jay mill explosion & Sappi's closure. W/ thousands of jobs at stake Congress must act to support loggers.   I’m supporting a bill that would direct @USDA to provide relief payments so our timber businesses stay afloat. https://t.co/k4oTujaxOt

Instead of working to slow the spread of #COVID19 Trump has chosen to focus on hiding critical info from the public at a time where reliable scientific data is *literally* a matter of life or death.  This is outrageous. The Trump admin must rescind this & put public health first https://t.co/vLHuWaGLkq

87000+ Mainers filed for unemployment last week. Food insecurity in our state could rise almost 40% due to #COVID19. Americans are struggling to meet their most basic financial needs.  The House passed a new round of $1200 stimulus checks 61 days ago. Where's @senatemajldr?

More than 190000 Mainers requested absentee ballots for today's primary election.  60 days ago the House passed the Heroes Act which would make vote-by-mail accessible nationwide & provide $29M in election aid to Maine during #COVID19. The Senate must pass the Heroes Act. https://t.co/YyWpQA8ET5
Taxpayers funded the development of a COVID-19 vaccine.   It should be free and available to all once it’s discovered.

Before #COVID19 our clean energy sector was among the fastest growing in the United States.   It can be again but Congress must make a down payment on our planet’s future to kick start the economy. 🌍   We need a #greenstimulus investment NOW! https://t.co/p5emAfBv9s

.@FeedingMaine estimates that food insecurity in Maine will rise up to 39% due to #COVID19. Every $1 of SNAP spent generates between $1.50-$1.80 in economic activity.   For our health & economy we must increase benefits by 15% & raise the minimum monthly benefit from $16 to $30. https://t.co/Pw4TvocVfa

In two days rent is due for millions of Americans who are out of work. Congress prevented mass evictions in early #COVID19 response legislation but those federal protections end July 25. Today I’m voting for H.R. 7301 to deliver urgent housing relief.   https://t.co/Oe6rFe95LH

Today I am voting for H.R. 1425 to:  ⚖️Protect the ACA from the Trump admin’s numerous attempts to overturn it  🏥Enhance the ACA so that the millions of Americans battling #COVID19 are covered  🩺Keep 500k Americans who’ve lost employer-sponsored insurance connected to care

~3M Americans are battling a #COVID19 diagnosis & 500K have lost their health insurance due to a job loss.   What’s the Trump admin doing in this crisis? Petitioning the SCOTUS to overturn the #ACA & protections for people with preexisting conditions.   The cruelty is the point. https://t.co/qCdJ5dRAuV
This Executive Order is yet another example of President Trump using the coronavirus pandemic to advance a hateful and extreme anti-immigrant agenda. https://t.co/CEqG4JvNyl

From construction & manufacturing to transportation & finance the clean energy sector employs 3.4M Americans but 620k have lost their jobs due to the pandemic.  I'm urging House leadership to prioritize relief for these workers who’ve been overlooked in past #COVID19 packages. https://t.co/tLI4z8Ug18

Thank you Chef Melissa Kelly for testifying before @HouseSmallBiz today and describing your personal experience with PPP and the unique strain #COVID19 has put on the restaurant industry in Maine. #mepolitics   We appreciate your perspective! https://t.co/DXFmTfumTl

Today at 1pm Chef Melissa Kelly owner of @PrimoMaine in Rockland will testify before the @HouseSmallBiz about how businesses like hers have been impacted by #COVID19. She can provide real-world insight into the challenges with & value of @SBAgov's relief programs.  #mepolitics https://t.co/28n10tbBo3

Pres. Trump had four years to meet with Maine fishermen who have been devastated by his reckless trade and commerce policies but did not. When Congress approved $300M in #COVID19 relief money for the fishing industry the Trump Admin dragged its feet to release that money.

Every night millions of Americans are protesting police brutality & racism nationwide   42+ million are out of work  109000+ are dead from COVID-19 & 1.9 million are infected   President Trump: don’t come to Maine tomorrow and campaign while our nation is in crisis https://t.co/wOaiOMV34N

Since COVID-19 has made it impossible for him to hold political rallies President Trump is using a trip to Maine’s 2nd congressional district as a way to have a backdoor campaign event at our expense. #mepolitics

Governor Mills has good reason to worry that President Trump’s vitriol could spark unrest in Maine. While the nation mourns the killing of George Floyd and the deaths of more than 106000 Americans to COVID-19 he is using the bully pulpit to incite violence. 1/

Thousands are protesting police violence and systemic racism nationwide  106k Americans are dead from COVID-19  40 million are out of work  President Trump’s response? Hide in a bunker with the White House’s lights turned off. https://t.co/Ny5w8tgcmd
COVID-19 is disproportionately infecting African Americans in Maine and nationwide. These racial disparities are not only an injustice they represent an oppressive problem in our country.

Today at an @AppropsDems hearing I asked @DeptVetAffairs what they're doing to end hunger for veterans across the country. Veterans are almost 2x as likely to go hungry and need has increased dramatically during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/bIrq517BFa

TUNE IN at 10am: I’ll be asking Secretary Wilkie about the @DeptVetAffairs’s response to the needs of our veterans during the #COVID19 pandemic especially how the agency is addressing food insecurity and telehealth access among our returning service members. #mepolitics https://t.co/B8zx3BK8gn

This weekend usually marks the start of grilling season but meat supply chain problems caused by #COVID19 have left many supermarket shelves bare.  Industrial meat production is failing us. My bipartisan bill the PRIME Act would help small farms put local food on our plates. https://t.co/H4RUQb5Im7

Nearly 100000 Americans have died from COVID-19. May we long remember them and recognize the grief this pandemic has caused their friends and families who in many cases could not be physically by their loved one’s side.   Maine mourns with you. https://t.co/k03Y45EKvZ https://t.co/beJnZyt5Xf

With large processing plants shuttered due to the COVID-19 pandemic and the nation facing a meat supply shortage we need to pass the PRIME Act my bipartisan bill to remove hurdles for small livestock farmers to sell directly to consumers. https://t.co/kWAH277ROD

Maine ranks 49 out of 50 states for broadband access & #COVID19 has exacerbated this disparity.   The Heroes Act would provide $1.5B to close the homework gap w/ Wi-Fi hotspots/connected devices for students and library patrons + $4B for emergency home connectivity. #mepolitics https://t.co/kqDWfNBEgM

How would The Heroes Act safeguard the health of Mainers? ✅Create ACA Special Enrollment ✅Eliminate cost-sharing for #COVID19 testing & treatment ✅Mandate and fund a nat’l testing & contract tracing system ✅$110B+ for providers to keep their doors open https://t.co/zaHugp6RCJ

1.7 million jobs in the U.S. are directly tied to domestic fisheries thousands of those jobs are in Maine.   The Heroes Act would provide an additional $100M in #COVID19 relief to our nation’s fisheries hard hit by this pandemic. #mepolitics  https://t.co/tEBninHUpO

There's a nat'l meat shortage   Grocery workers are “essential” but rarely have sick leave   Lines grow longer at food banks as farmers are forced to dump milk   #COVID19 has exposed a food system in dire need of reform. My op-ed in today's @PressHerald ⤵️ https://t.co/RLtyYdcRSP

GREAT NEWS: Maine is 1 of 20 states approved for Pandemic EBT (P-EBT). This approval will ensure that 82k+ Maine students who are eligible for free or reduced lunch will receive breakfast and lunch even though schools are closed. #COVID19 shouldn't cause any kids to go hungry. https://t.co/rMT8GKSukn

I’ve joined 90+ of my colleagues in urging House leaders to prioritize mental health services for our health care workers in the next #COVID19 relief package. With income and sales tax revenues drastically reduced due to #COVID19 Maine is facing its biggest shortfall in three decades. I've cosponsored H.R. 6592 to allocate $500B to state and local governments and give state officials flexibility to fill in revenue gaps. #mepolitics https://t.co/5sKMwK7HVz

As of tonight 50k+ Americans have died from the coronavirus 47 Mainers among them. Let us mourn them as people not numbers. They were neighbors parents children siblings friends. We can honor them by doing our part to stay home and preventing the spread of this disease.

The Payroll Guarantee Act which takes a similar approach to #COVID19 relief policies in the United Kingdom Netherlands Ireland France Germany Denmark & Australia would cover 100% of wages for workers and maintain their employer-sponsored benefits. https://t.co/tyCdgogxzc

In the next #COVID19 package Congress needs to fix PPP’s structural deficiencies & consider a different model for maintaining the livelihoods of workers & small businesses. That's why I’ve cosponsored the Payroll Guarantee Act to provide immediate direct cash support to workers.

This #COVID19 funding package will help small businesses keep employees but it is far from sufficient. For tens of thousands of Mainers who’ve lost their income a one-time stimulus check is not enough to address the bills that are still arriving on time. #mepolitics

While I am glad this #COVID19 package will now allow small farmers to take advantage of the Economic Injury Disaster Loan (EIDL) program and help community-based banks to lend it does not address the structural problems with the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP).

Widespread testing is the best possible way to get Mainers back to work and help our economy rebound. H.R. 266 will require the Trump admin to finally develop a national testing strategy and provide $25 billion for states to expand their #COVID19 testing capacity.

The House is voting on the next #COVID19 relief package in waves to adhere to CDC's distancing guidance. I'm in the 6th wave + will vote in favor of the bill b/c it will expand #coronavirus testing and deliver billions in critical aid to health care providers & small businesses. https://t.co/2mogAGYUpN

I got the first flight from #Maine to DC this AM to vote on the next #COVID19 relief package which will renew critical funding for our small businesses and hospitals and expand testing capacity. I’ve never seen the airport so empty.  #mepolitics https://t.co/Wu9rrMa6sf

Congress’s next #coronavirus aid package must provide student loan assistance by implementing an immediate moratorium on all negative credit reporting and ensure a period of debt forgiveness or loan forbearance with no additional interest accrued.

The next #COVID19 stimulus bill must maintain election integrity: ☑️Implement nationwide no-excuse absentee voting ☑️Dedicate at least $500M to states to implement mail-in voting programs ☑️Provide appropriate polling place adjustments to uphold public health

Congress’s third #COVID19 stimulus must require private health insurers Medicare Part B Medicare Advantage Medicaid CHIP TRICARE and the Indian Health Service to fully cover #coronavirus testing and treatment with no out-of-pocket cost.

The next #COVID19 stimulus should provide no-interest no-fee loans + other direct assistance to small business owners + nonprofits to cover costs including people who are self-employed. We also need loan forgiveness for businesses that retain and pay their employees.

The next #coronavirus stimulus package should implement a temporary nationwide moratorium on evictions and foreclosures for homeowners and renters and provide emergency rental assistance to renters directly impacted by the #COVID19 pandemic.

The next #coronavirus stimulus package must guarantee immediate cash assistance. That means targeted monthly payments that can help pay rent buy food and keep families afloat for the duration of this crisis.
